Description: Typical range for delicate organic materials like bamboo to remove surface contaminants without charring; starting at 50 W for controlled ablation. Max safe to avoid substrate damage based on thermal sensitivity of lignocellulosic fibers. Source: Studies on laser cleaning of wood (e.g., Journal of Cultural Heritage, 2018, adapted for bamboo).
Near-IR wavelength for optimal absorption in bamboo contaminants with minimal substrate damage
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning resolution on bamboo surface features
Optimal repetition rate for continuous cleaning coverage with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for efficient contaminant removal with controlled thermal penetration
Optimal scanning speed for efficient area coverage while maintaining cleaning effectiveness
Number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal without substrate damage
Beam overlap percentage for uniform cleaning coverage across bamboo surface
